MyDomainDiscoverableLogin.name: MyDomainDiscoverableLogin
MyDomainDiscoverableLogin.description: Represents configuration settings when the My Domain login page type is Discovery. Login Discovery provides an identity-first login experience, where the login page contains the identifier field only. Based on the identifier entered, a handler determines how to authenticate the user.

ApexHandlerId.description: The ID of the Apex handler that contains the Discovery authentication logic.

DeveloperName.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization.

ExecuteApexHandlerAsId.description: The ID of the user who is executing the handler. Requires Manage User permission.

MasterLabel.description: The name of the action link group template.

UsernameLabel.description: Login prompt on login page when the My Domain login page type is Discovery. It supports localization with custom labels.
